intro: Artanthe eriopoda, commonly known as the woolly artanthe, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features soft, woolly foliage that gives it its common name, and it produces small, daisy-like blooms in shades of pink and white. Artanthe eriopoda is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and drought tolerance. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and dry landscapes.
